titleStmt.title: Ioabs counsell and King Davids seasonable hearing it. Delivered in a sermon before the Honourable House of Commons, at their late solemne fast, Feb. 22. By W. Bridges, preacher of the Gospell at Dunstans in the East, London.
titleStmt.author: Bridges, Walter.
Bridge, William, 1600?-1670, attributed name.
England and Wales. Parliament. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by R. Cotes, for Andrew Crooke, and are to be sold at his shop at the signe of the Greene Dragon, in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: With an order to print on verso of first leaf dated: "22. Feb. 1642 [i.e. 1643]".
Running title reads: A sermon preached at a fast before the Honourable House of Commons.
In this edition: there is no comma after "counsell" on the title page; line 11 on title page ends "Gospell".

place.placeName: his shop at the signe of the Greene Dragon, in Pauls Church-yard
